text: Two ships of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary have borne the name RFA Oakleaf: * was the ocean liner Montezuma, acquired by the RFA in 1915 as a dummy battleship to imitate , and named Abadol. She was renamed Oakleaf in 1917 and was sunk by a U-boat later that year. * was a tanker launched in 1981 as the Oktania. She was acquired by the RFA in 1986 and was retired from active service as in 2007 and later scrapped. Category:Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship names
title: RFA Oakleaf
